statement: Centralizing rate-limit and concurrency constraints in engine-side policy objects (pools/tags) will reduce external API failures and simplify team-specific overrides.
rationale: Airflow pools and Prefect concurrency limits show explicit constraints reduce overload while allowing per-team policies.
keyAssumptions: Engine can enforce concurrency limits across all workflows
validationCriteria: Observed rate-limit errors decline after adoption
critiquePoints: Per-provider limits may require additional dynamic signals
questions: How should teams override or scope limits? per project, provider, or model?
